required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influences of Different Temporary Cement on Retention Rate of Temporary Crowns
clinical_study.official_title: Influences of Different Temporary Cement on Retention Rate and Dental Sensitivity of Temporary Crown on Vital Teeth - Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is through a randomized clinical trial, double blind, split-mouth, evaluate the success rate (retention rate and dental sensibility) of temporary dental crown cemented on vital teeth. The composition of the cement (Based on calcium hydroxide; and based on mineral trioxide aggregate) will be evaluated. Data will be collected, tabulated and submitted to statistical analysis.

detailed_description.textblock: The confecction of temporary prosthesis is a fundamental step in the prosthetic process of definitive total crowns. The temporary cementation should provide sufficient retention between the intervals of the consultations, be biocompatible and not present high solubility. The aim of this study is through a randomized clinical trial, double blind, splithmouth, evaluate the success rate (retention rate and dental sensibility) of temporary dental crown cemented on vital teeth. The composition of the cement (Based on calcium hydroxide; and based on mineral trioxide aggregate) will be evaluated. Twenty participants with at least two vital teeth with the need to confection of definitive total crowns (each participant) will be selected who present. The teeth will be randomly divided into 2 different groups according to the temporary cement composition (Based on calcium hydroxide; and based on mineral trioxide aggregate). Data will be collected, tabulated and submitted to statistical analysis

primary_outcome.measure: Success rate (retention rate and absence of sensibility) of temporary dental crown cemented with different temporary cement with a 6 months follow up

arm_group.description: Cementation of a temporary crown with cement based on calcium hydroxide.
Cementation of a temporary crown with cement based on Mineral trioxide aggregate .

intervention.intervention_name: Temporary cement based on Calcium Hydroxide
intervention.description: Confection of a temporary crown with acrylic resin; Finishing and polishing; relative isolation with cotton and gauze; Manipulation of the temporary cement based on Calcium Hydroxide; Cement insertion on the internal surface of the temporary crown; Excess cement removal; Occlusal Adjustment.

Confection of a temporary crown with acrylic resin; Finishing and polishing; relative isolation with cotton and gauze; Manipulation of the temporary cement based on Mineral trioxide aggregate; Cement insertion on the internal surface of the temporary crown; Excess cement removal; Occlusal Adjustment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers; both genres; presence of at least two teeth with indication of total crowns; good oral hygiene.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Dentures or orthodontics; presence of periodontal disease and,or parafunctional habits; systemic disease and, or severe psychological; constant use of analgesic and, or anti-inflammatory or allergic response to dental products.

contact.last_name: Paulo V Soares, DDS, MS, PHD
